intro: Hieracium acrifrons, commonly known as the sharp-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, producing achenes as its seeds. Hieracium acrifrons is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
